item.title: To the people debating the Colorado Proud Boys on Saturday:...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

To the people debating the Colorado Proud Boys on Saturday:

There's no "talking it out" with a neo-fascist gang who brings armed neo-Nazis to family drag shows.

Fascism is not a valid philosophy and hate is not up for debate.

...

You can't debate revisionism, conspiracy theories, misogyny, xenophobia, anti Semitism, anti blackness, Islamophobia or transphobia.

These people are enemies of the working class and they are committed to misunderstanding and hate.

The only way to talk to Nazis is with your fist.

Promotion of yt supremacy is not a valid contribution to the public conscience and we should reject anyone who says it is. We must reject the emboldenment of yt supremacy now or we are doomed to fight it in the future. Hate speech is inseparable from action and organization. People who defend the "free speech" of fascists are defending the claim that the community response to yt supremacy is equivalent to state repression. It is not.

Every Proud Boy rally presents an opportunity for fascists to network and collaborate. We know from history what happens time and time again when fascists achieve such coordination.The Proud Boys have violent goals and Colorado Proud Boys have been violent in Denver, Fort Collins and the Springs over and over and over again.

See More

item.title: "Tell him about what kind of hell you've been catching...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Tell him about what kind of hell you've been catching and tell him to clean his house up. And if he's not ready to clean his house up, he shouldn't have a house. It should catch on fire and burn down." Malcom X, 1962

Left Voice

After back-to-back hurricanes and years of cuts to social programs that have left thousands facing hunger and homelessness, the Congress of Guatemala has passed... yet another austerity budget that takes from the most vulnerable to line the pockets of the rich.

Now the people are taking to the streets to protest a government that does not represent them. Over 10,000 people gathered in the capital's central square.

In the first video, protestors can be seen setting the Congress on fire.
#guatemala #protests

item.title: On June 25, under the pressure of mass protests against racist...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

On June 25, under the pressure of mass protests against racist police killings, Governor Jared Polis issued an executive order which would open an independent investigation into Elijah McClain’s death, led by state Attorney General Phil Weiser. This was after Aurora District Attorney Dave Young declined to file any charges against the killers, then the city of Aurora opened a sham investigation led by a former cop which was terminated because it was plainly not “independent”.... Now it is up to Phil Weiser to decide whether the cops and paramedics responsible for Elijah’s death will face any criminal charges.

But just this week, Governor Polis quietly loosened the scope of the investigation, allowing Weiser to investigate for “offenses”, not just “criminal activity” related to Elijah’s death, opening up the possibility for him to come back with watered down charges against the killers, like we saw in Breonna Taylor’s case. Polis also took out the words that suggest someone caused the death of Elijah McClain.

Polis must think that the movement isn’t paying attention, that we’ve been subdued by the repressive arrests of movement leaders, and now he can reel back his investigation without opposition in the streets. He is wrong.

Join us for an emergency action to make it clear that we are still here and we are not going anywhere until we get justice for Elijah McClain!

MASKS REQUIRED (OVER YOUR NOSE & MOUTH!) & PLEASE KEEP DISTANCE BETWEEN YOURSELF AND OTHERS.

See More

SAT, NOV 21

EMERGENCY ACTION: Eyes on Weiser! Justice for Elijah McClain!

Colorado State Capitol

· DenverCauses · 479 people

item.title: This is a blatant display of the hyper-exploitation of immigrant...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

This is a blatant display of the hyper-exploitation of immigrant workers. A recent lawsuit alleges that managers at Tyson placed bets on how many workers would contract COVID-19 while working and ordered workers to continue working-- even while symptomatic.

A lawsuit claims that Tyson Foods ordered employees to work during the pandemic while managers privately wagered money on how many of them would contract COVID-19.

iowacapitaldispatch.com

Lawsuit: Tyson managers bet money on how many workers would contract COVID-19 - Iowa Capital Dispatch

A lawsuit claims that Tyson Foods ordered employees to work during the pandemic while managers privately wagered money on how many of them would contract COVID-19.A lawsuit claims that Tyson Foods ordered employees to work during the pandemic while managers privately wagered money on how many of them would contract COVID-19.

item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "For the second time in four years, fears that a Democrat...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"For the second time in four years, fears that a Democrat would be elected president sent private prison stocks plummeting earlier this month. To the casual observer, the prospect of President-elect Joe Biden—who promised to “stop corporations from profiteering from incarceration”—presented an existential threat to the multi-billion dollar industry.This article was published in partnership with Slate.But the big players in private prisons, CoreCivic and Geo Group, are not pan...icking—and rumors of their impending demise have been exaggerated. That’s because they’ve been steadily diversifying, placing their bets on a future that includes revenue from commercial real estate, electronic monitoring, and halfway houses.

On a quarterly earnings call just two days after the election, CoreCivic CEO Damon Hininger was asked about the possibility that a Biden administration may end the company’s contracts with the federal Bureau of Prisons. He replied confidently, “We think our risk is pretty minimal there.” He noted that back in 2010, the agency accounted for 15 percent of the company’s revenue. Today it’s just 2 percent.The companies still care which party controls the government: A Newsweek analysis of political contributions from GEO and CoreCivic’s political action committees found that both heavily favored Republicans in political donations during the 2020 cycle. About 95 percent of GEO’s nearly $1 million in donations went to GOP candidates and the party, as did more than 87 percent of CoreCivic’s $181,000."

See MoreCoreCivic and GEO Group have been shifting away from prisons toward other government contracts, like office space and immigration detention.

themarshallproject.org

Think Private Prison Companies Are Going Away Under Biden? They Have Other Plans

CoreCivic and GEO Group have been shifting away from prisons toward other government contracts, like office space and immigration detention.CoreCivic and GEO Group have been shifting away from prisons toward other government contracts, like office space and immigration detention.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "In a sweeping change to its immigration practices, Mexico...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"In a sweeping change to its immigration practices, Mexico has stopped holding migrant children and their families in detention centers, bowing to international pressure from human rights groups that criticized the practice as inhumane.

The reform, which took effect this week, also gives migrant children temporary legal status in Mexico in order to avoid immediate deportation and allow time for them to seek legal avenues for staying in the country.

[...]

...

Mexico’s immigration agency, which runs detention centers, opposed the reform [...]"

See MoreThe United Nations said the reform is an 'historic advance' in human rights

vice.com

Migrant Children Will No Longer Be Held in Detention in Mexico

The United Nations said the reform is an 'historic advance' in human rightsThe United Nations said the reform is an 'historic advance' in human rights
